column1: Write the reaction of CoCl2 anhydrous with Water
g in t2g and eg stands for
column3: Gerade's wavefunction will be even in nature. It will have a centre of inversion.

column1: Common ligands in descending order of splitting
column2: CO=CN-,PPh3, NO2-, phen, bipy, en, NH3, py, CH3CN, NCS-, H2O=Ox,OH-,F-,Cl-,NCS-,Br-,I-
column4: Incase of NCS-, type NCS- for both N donor and S donor. Comma seperate.

column1: Incase of several absorption lines ________ is taken for splitting calculations

column3: Apparently one 2/3 because 4 ligands instead of 6. And 2/3 for approaching from corners instead of face centres

column1: Magnetic Moment in terms of total spin (s)
column3: sqrt(n(n+2)) = sqrt(2s(2s+2)) = 2sqrt(s(s+2)) where n is the number of unpaired

column1: Splitting strength in ascending order of metal centres
column3: Smaller ones split more because of more repulsions. Higher charged split stronger because of better interactions
